basics.name: Luong Tin Phan
basics.label: Robotics Engineer/Scientist
basics.summary: I am a robotics engineer/scientist with a passion for developing innovative solutions in the field of robotics. I have a strong background in robotics, software development, machine learning. My goal is to contribute to the advancement of robotics technology and its applications in various industries.

work.name: Next Robotics
work.summary: Teaching at Palmer Physical Laboratory (now 302 Frist Campus Center). While not a professor at Princeton, I associated with the physics professors and continued to give lectures on campus.

awards.title: Full Scholarship for PhD Program
awards.summary: Awarded a full scholarship for the PhD program in Robotics at Sungkyunkwan University, covering tuition and living expenses.

latest publications.name: Development of A Quadruped Robot System with Torque-Controllable Modular Actuator Unit
Study on Effects of Spinal Joint for Running Quadruped Robots
